dcterms:creator: Johan Bjureberg
Marie Dahlin
Andreas Carlborg
Hanna Edberg
Axel Haglund
Bo Runeson
dcterms:description: The Columbia Suicide Severity Rating Scale (CSSRS) is a tool used to assess the severity of suicidal ideation and behavior in patients, providing a structured approach for clinicians to evaluate suicide risk.
dcterms:title: Columbia Suicide Severity Rating Scale (CSSRS)

dcterms:creator: Manas Gaur
Vamsi Aribandi
Amanuel Alambo
Ugur Kursuncu
Krishnaprasad Thirunarayan
Jonathan Beich
Jyotishman Pathak
Amit Sheth
dcterms:description: The Gaur et al. dataset is used for assessing suicidality on Reddit, utilizing the CSSRS to label user posts from suicide-related subreddits, providing a real-world test-bed for evaluating performance and explainability of models.
dcterms:title: Gaur et al. dataset (for suicidality assessment)

dcterms:description: The PK enhanced CSSRS dataset is created for the study to include both process knowledge and labels for suicidality assessment, expanding upon the CSSRS framework.
dcterms:title: PK enhanced CSSRS dataset
